results.raw_content:
Land Of Basketball.com

Teams, players profiles, awards, stats, records and championships.

Michael Jordan

Michael Jordan Playoff Series - Basic Stats

Michael Jordan averages for every series he played in the NBA Playoffs. Here you can see how many points, rebounds, assists, steals and blocks he averaged against every playoff rival and how many series he played, won and lost.

Show Stats: by Year (Basic) / by Year (Full) / by Points / by Rebounds / by Assists / by Steals / by Blocks

In 15 NBA seasons (from 1985 to 2003) Michael Jordan played in 13 Playoffs. His postseason appearances include a total of 179 games in 37 Playoff series. His team won 30 of those series and lost 7.

Michael Jordan Playoff Series - Summary

 | Played | Won | Lost | %
Playoff Series: | 37 | 30 | 7 | .811
Stats | PointsPts | ReboundsReb | AssistsAst | StealsStl | BlocksBlk
Playoff Averages: | 33.4 | 6.4 | 5.7 | 2.1 | 0.9
Single Series Highs: | 45.2(in 1988) | 10.2(in 1997) | 11.4(in 1991) | 4.0(in 1990) | 2.3(in 1987)
